verses.text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.

And now, verily I say unto you, I give unto you a commandment that you continue in the ministry and presidency.
And I said unto him: Lord, give unto me power over death, that I may live and bring souls unto thee.

And now, my brethren, I desire that ye shall plant this word in your hearts, and as it beginneth to swell even so nourish it by your faith. And behold, it will become a tree, springing up in you unto everlasting life. And then may God grant unto you that your burdens may be light, through the joy of his Son. And even all this can ye do if ye will. Amen.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.
That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
And it shall come to pass that whosoever shall believe on the Son of God, the same shall have everlasting life.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.
He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.
And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Believest thou this?
Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.

Yea, verily I say unto you, if ye will come unto me ye shall have eternal life. Behold, mine arm of mercy is extended towards you, and whosoever will come, him will I receive; and blessed are those who come unto me.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.

similars.text: Speaking of the resurrection of the dead, concerning those who shall hear the voice of the Son of Man:
Behold, there is a time appointed that all shall come forth from the dead. Now when this time cometh no one knows; but God knoweth the time which is appointed.
For behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, the time is soon at hand that I shall come in a cloud with power and great glory.
For the hour is nigh, and that which was spoken by mine apostles must be fulfilled; for as they spoke so shall it come to pass;

But, behold, verily I say unto you, before the earth shall pass away, Michael, mine archangel, shall sound his trump, and then shall all the dead awake, for their graves shall be opened, and they shall come forth--yea, even all.
Who among you will give ear to this? who will hearken and hear for the time to come?
But verily I say unto you, that I have decreed a decree which my people shall realize, inasmuch as they hearken from this very hour unto the counsel which I, the Lord their God, shall give unto them.
Verily I say unto you, There be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, when these things shall be made known unto them of the Father, and shall come forth of the Father, from them unto you;
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.
Verily, verily, I say unto you who now hear my words, which are my voice, blessed are ye inasmuch as you receive these things;
Yea, verily I say unto you, in that day when the Lord shall come, he shall reveal all things--
For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:
But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.

Verily, thus saith the Lord unto you concerning your dead: When any of you are baptized for your dead, let there be a recorder, and let him be eye-witness of your baptisms; let him hear with his ears, that he may testify of a truth, saith the Lord;
And verily, verily, I say unto you, that this is my voice unto all. Amen.
I, the Lord God, have spoken it; but the hour and the day no man knoweth, neither the angels in heaven, nor shall they know until he comes.
And the servants of God shall go forth, saying with a loud voice: Fear God and give glory to him, for the hour of his judgment is come;
Verily I say unto you, even now, if he will hearken unto my voice, it shall be well with him. Even so. Amen.

And I saw that I must soon go down to my grave, having been wrought upon by the power of God that I must preach and prophesy unto this people, and declare the word according to the truth which is in Christ. And I have declared it in all my days, and have rejoiced in it above that of the world.
And the voice of warning shall be unto all people, by the mouths of my disciples, whom I have chosen in these last days.

Hearken, O ye Gentiles, and hear the words of Jesus Christ, the Son of the living God, which he hath commanded me that I should speak concerning you, for, behold he commandeth me that I should write, saying:
Behold, verily I say unto you, that these are the words of the Lord your God.

Yea, verily I say unto you, if ye will come unto me ye shall have eternal life. Behold, mine arm of mercy is extended towards you, and whosoever will come, him will I receive; and blessed are those who come unto me.
And ye shall know that I am the Lord, when I have opened your graves, O my people, and brought you up out of your graves,
Behold, thus saith the Lord unto the elders whom he hath called and chosen in these last days, by the voice of his Spirit--
Behold, they say unto me, Where is the word of the Lord? let it come now.
And again I say, hearken unto my voice, lest death shall overtake you; in an hour when ye think not the summer shall be past, and the harvest ended, and your souls not saved.
And it shall be upon Aaron to minister: and his sound shall be heard when he goeth in unto the holy place before the Lord, and when he cometh out, that he die not.

Yea, verily I say unto you again, the time has come when the voice of the Lord is unto you: Go ye out of Babylon; gather ye out from among the nations, from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
Speaking of the resurrection of the dead, concerning those who shall hear the voice of the Son of Man:
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.
Verily I say unto you, There be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.

verses.text: For as the Father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself;

similars.text: For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.
As the living Father hath sent me, and I live by the Father: so he that eateth me, even he shall live by me.
He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.

verses.text: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man.

similars.text: For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son:

Behold, it came to pass that the son of Nephihah was appointed to fill the judgment-seat, in the stead of his father; yea, he was appointed chief judge and governor over the people, with an oath and sacred ordinance to judge righteously, and to keep the peace and the freedom of the people, and to grant unto them their sacred privileges to worship the Lord their God, yea, to support and maintain the cause of God all his days, and to bring the wicked to justice according to their crime.
And Emer did execute judgment in righteousness all his days, and he begat many sons and daughters; and he begat Coriantum, and he anointed Coriantum to reign in his stead.
Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king's son.
Let no man think he is ruler; but let God rule him that judgeth, according to the counsel of his own will, or, in other words, him that counseleth or sitteth upon the judgment seat.

verses.text: Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,
And shall come forth; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.

similars.text: And shall come forth; they who have done good, in the resurrection of the just; and they who have done evil, in the resurrection of the unjust.

If they be good, to the resurrection of endless life and happiness; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of endless damnation, being delivered up to the devil, who hath subjected them, which is damnation--
These are they who shall come forth in the resurrection of the just.

If they be good, to the resurrection of everlasting life; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of damnation; being on a parallel, the one on the one hand and the other on the other hand, according to the mercy, and the justice, and the holiness which is in Christ, who was before the world began.

He hath given unto you that ye might know good from evil, and he hath given unto you that ye might choose life or death; and ye can do good and be restored unto that which is good, or have that which is good restored unto you; or ye can do evil, and have that which is evil restored unto you.
Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.
And have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

Yea, who shall be consigned to a state of endless misery, fulfilling the words which say: They that have done good shall have everlasting life; and they that have done evil shall have everlasting damnation. And thus it is. Amen.
For thus saith the Lord; Like as I have brought all this great evil upon this people, so will I bring upon them all the good that I have promised them.
And blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.

Verily, verily I say unto you, blessed are such, for they shall obtain; for I, the Lord, show mercy unto all the meek, and upon all whomsoever I will, that I may be justified when I shall bring them unto judgment.

Yea, concerning that which was to come, and also concerning the resurrection of the dead, and the redemption of the people, which was to be brought to pass through the power, and sufferings, and death of Christ, and his resurrection and ascension into heaven.

Yea, verily I say unto you, if ye will come unto me ye shall have eternal life. Behold, mine arm of mercy is extended towards you, and whosoever will come, him will I receive; and blessed are those who come unto me.

And then shall they rejoice; for they shall know that it is a blessing unto them from the hand of God; and their scales of darkness shall begin to fall from their eyes; and many generations shall not pass away among them, save they shall be a pure and a delightsome people.
If he has desired to do evil, and has not repented in his days, behold, evil shall be done unto him, according to the restoration of God.
Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.
Therefore, blessed are they who will repent and hearken unto the voice of the Lord their God; for these are they that shall be saved.

And there shall rise up one mighty among them, who shall do much good, both in word and in deed, being an instrument in the hands of God, with exceeding faith, to work mighty wonders, and do that thing which is great in the sight of God, unto the bringing to pass much restoration unto the house of Israel, and unto the seed of thy brethren.

Looking forward to that day, thus retaining a remission of their sins; being filled with great joy because of the resurrection of the dead, according to the will and power and deliverance of Jesus Christ from the bands of death.
But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.
And, behold, one came and said unto him, Good Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?

And if their works are evil they shall be restored unto them for evil. Therefore, all things shall be restored to their proper order, every thing to its natural frame--mortality raised to immortality, corruption to incorruption--raised to endless happiness to inherit the kingdom of God, or to endless misery to inherit the kingdom of the devil, the one on one hand, the other on the other--
Shew the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that ye are gods: yea, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed, and behold it together.
And shall come forth; they who have done good, in the resurrection of the just; and they who have done evil, in the resurrection of the unjust.
And shall come forth; they who have done good, in the resurrection of the just; and they who have done evil, in the resurrection of the unjust.

If they be good, to the resurrection of endless life and happiness; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of endless damnation, being delivered up to the devil, who hath subjected them, which is damnation--
These are they who shall come forth in the resurrection of the just.
And these shall go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal.

verses.text: I can of mine own self do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my judgment is just; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of the Father which hath sent me.

similars.text: And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.
But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged of you, or of man's judgment: yea, I judge not mine own self.
And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.
For I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.
Let no man think he is ruler; but let God rule him that judgeth, according to the counsel of his own will, or, in other words, him that counseleth or sitteth upon the judgment seat.
For I know nothing by myself; yet am I not hereby justified: but he that judgeth me is the Lord.
And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.
For I know nothing by myself; yet am I not hereby justified: but he that judgeth me is the Lord.

verses.text: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

similars.text: There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.
I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.

verses.text: There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.

similars.text: I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

And this is not all. Do ye not suppose that I know of these things myself? Behold, I testify unto you that I do know that these things whereof I have spoken are true. And how do ye suppose that I know of their surety?

Behold now, I do not say that these things shall be, of myself, because it is not of myself that I know these things; but behold, I know that these things are true because the Lord God has made them known unto me, therefore I testify that they shall be.

Ye are my witnesses, saith the Lord, and my servant whom I have chosen: that ye may know and believe me, and understand that I am he: before me there was no God formed, neither shall there be after me.
And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.
Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
But I have greater witness than that of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.
I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
But I have greater witness than that of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.
This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.
I tell thee these things as a witness unto thee--that the words or the work which thou hast been writing are true.
And he that saw it bare record, and his record is true: and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe.
Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth.
And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.

verses.text: Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth.

verses.text: But I receive not testimony from man: but these things I say, that ye might be saved.

But I have greater witness than that of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.

similars.text: I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater works than these shall he do; because I go unto my Father.
If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which he hath testified of his Son.
There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater works than these shall he do; because I go unto my Father.
I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.
Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.
Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father's name, they bear witness of me.

verses.text: And the Father himself, which hath sent me, hath borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape.

similars.text: I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.
For I have not spoken of myself; but the Father which sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.

verses.text: And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.

similars.text: For they prophesy falsely unto you in my name: I have not sent them, saith the Lord.
Behold, and lo, there are none to deliver you; for ye obeyed not my voice when I called to you out of the heavens; ye believed not my servants, and when they were sent unto you ye received them not.
And now I have this day declared it to you; but ye have not obeyed the voice of the Lord your God, nor any thing for the which he hath sent me unto you.
For I have not sent them, saith the Lord, yet they prophesy a lie in my name; that I might drive you out, and that ye might perish, ye, and the prophets that prophesy unto you.
He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father's which sent me.

And wo be unto him that will not hearken unto the words of Jesus, and also to them whom he hath chosen and sent among them; for whoso receiveth not the words of Jesus and the words of those whom he hath sent receiveth not him; and therefore he will not receive them at the last day;
And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, it cannot defile him;
For are not the words of Abinadi fulfilled, which he prophesied against us--and all this because we would not hearken unto the words of the Lord, and turn from our iniquities?
For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him.
How is it that ye have not hearkened unto the word of the Lord?
He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of the Lord, we will not hearken unto thee.

verses.text: Search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.

similars.text: These things have I written unto you that believe on the name of the Son of God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may believe on the name of the Son of God.

verses.text: And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.

similars.text: Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither ye cannot come.

verses.text: I receive not honour from men.

similars.text: I command and men obey not; I revoke and they receive not the blessing.
Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.

verses.text: But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.
I am come in my Father's name, and ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.

similars.text: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.
And he that receiveth me receiveth my Father;
At that day ye shall know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

Verily, if a man be called of my Father, as was Aaron, by mine own voice, and by the voice of him that sent me, and I have endowed him with the keys of the power of this priesthood, if he do anything in my name, and according to my law and by my word, he will not commit sin, and I will justify him.
And the Father and I are one. I am in the Father and the Father in me; and inasmuch as ye have received me, ye are in me and I in you.
I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee:
And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me.
All that the Father giveth me shall come to me; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.
But ye shall pray for them, and shall not cast them out; and if it so be that they come unto you oft ye shall pray for them unto the Father, in my name.
All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the Son is, but the Father; and who the Father is, but the Son, and he to whom the Son will reveal him.
Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad's life;
But if ye enter not into my law ye cannot receive the promise of my Father, which he made unto Abraham.

Nevertheless, ye shall not cast him out from among you, but ye shall minister unto him and shall pray for him unto the Father, in my name; and if it so be that he repenteth and is baptized in my name, then shall ye receive him, and shall minister unto him of my flesh and blood.
Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father who is in heaven.
Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.
And whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, which is right, believing that ye shall receive, behold it shall be given unto you.
At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you:
But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.
And he that receiveth me receiveth my Father;
And the Father and I are one. I am in the Father and the Father in me; and inasmuch as ye have received me, ye are in me and I in you.

verses.text: How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, and seek not the honour that cometh from God only?

similars.text: That all men should honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him.
He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

verses.text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father: there is one that accuseth you, even Moses, in whom ye trust.

similars.text: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.
Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Defraud not, Honour thy father and mother.
And Moses was very wroth, and said unto the Lord, Respect not thou their offering: I have not taken one ass from them, neither have I hurt one of them.
Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.

(And these are the words which I spake unto my servant Moses, and they are true even as I will; and I have spoken them unto you. See thou show them unto no man, until I command you, except to them that believe. Amen.)
My son, keep thy father's commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

Verily, if a man be called of my Father, as was Aaron, by mine own voice, and by the voice of him that sent me, and I have endowed him with the keys of the power of this priesthood, if he do anything in my name, and according to my law and by my word, he will not commit sin, and I will justify him.

But, behold, ye not only deny my words, but ye also deny all the words which have been spoken by our fathers, and also the words which were spoken by this man, Moses, who had such great power given unto him, yea, the words which he hath spoken concerning the coming of the Messiah.

verses.text: For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me.

similars.text: For the Lord had spoken unto Moses, saying,
But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

verses.text: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

similars.text: If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you of heavenly things?
And he said: Yea, I believe according to thy words.
And the Lord said unto him: Believest thou the words which I shall speak?
For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me.
Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.
Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Father is in me, and I in him.
Art thou the Christ? tell us. And he said unto them, If I tell you, ye will not believe:
Behold, if they will not believe my words, they would not believe you, my servant Joseph, if it were possible that you should show them all these things which I have committed unto you.
If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.
And he that believeth not my words believeth not my disciples; and if it so be that I do not speak, judge ye; for ye shall know that it is I that speaketh, at the last day.
